critique: This executive order allows federal employees residing in Arlington County, VA to run for and hold local office. It aims to balance the participation of government employees in local governance with the need to avoid conflicts of interest and maintain impartiality in federal service. The order emphasizes that employees must not neglect their duties or engage in partisan politics, and it allows the Civil Service Commission to suspend or withdraw the permission if activities become detrimental to the public interest. It also distinguishes between full-time and part-time local offices, requiring resignation from federal employment for full-time positions. The order seems to promote local self-government while safeguarding the integrity of the federal civil service.
